result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Renkas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Michael R Renkas in court, in custody with attorney George Andrew Limbeck.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases called - 15CF98, 14CF323, 15CF93 & 15CF248
Pleas taken - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Arguments by Bayne-Allison/Limbeck/Court to sentencing - 
15CF98 - Plea no contest to count 1 - Count 2 DRI - Costs/Surcharges only
14CF323 - DRI
15CF93 - DRI 
15CF248 - Motion to amend count 2 to misd. bail jumping - Granted by court - Plea no contest to count 1,2,3 - Counts 4,5 DRI - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation consecutive to Forest County Prison sentence - AODA and follow thru with recommended treatment - Absolute sobriety - May not enter tavern premises - Restitution payable to Phillip Kamke $932.16 - Costs/surcharges in 15CF248 - Post conviction rights given
Defendant advised of restrictions that go along with a felony -
